intro: Opsanthe flava, commonly known as the yellow opsanthe, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers, which bloom in clusters during the warmer months. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along its slender stems. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The botanical interest of Opsanthe flava lies in its unique floral structure and its role in local ecosystems.
